qas.question: How many people lived in Lancashire in 1971?
What is the most populous geographic county in the UK?
When was the administrative county abolished?
What did the southern part of Lancashire turn into?
How many people like in the UK?
In what geographic region of Lancashire is Cumbria county?
How many people lived in Merseyside according to the 1971 census?
How many people lived in Lancashire in 1961?
How many people lived in Cumbria after it was made into a county in 1974?

context: By the census of 1971, the population of <a1_0>Lancashire<a1_0/> and its county boroughs had reached <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0>5,129,416<b8_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, making it the most populous geographic county in the UK. The administrative county was also the most populous of its type outside London, with a population of <b7_0><b9_0>2,280,359<b9_0/><b7_0/> in 1961. On <a2_0>1 April 1974<a2_0/>, under the Local Government Act 1972, the administrative county was abolished, as were the county boroughs. The urbanised <b6_0>southern part<b6_0/> largely became part of two metropolitan counties, <a3_0>Merseyside and Greater Manchester<a3_0/>. The new county of <a4_0>Cumbria<a4_0/> incorporates the Furness exclave.
